item.title: [OP-1162] The plotter scale is defined in the model
item.description:
Currently, the scale for plotter axes is always 0..1
It could be defined in the plotter's model, e.g. use 0..100, or 0..5
item.summary: The plotter scale is defined in the model

item.title: [OP-1160] Subtitles in assessment
item.description:
Goal: for long question lists, allow subtitles to group subquestions

That could be done two ways:

  • A new question type 'title'
  • use group
  • top level groups are dimensions
  • other level groups are inline with other questions and get a score based on the subquestions (same logic)

Verify that this has no impact on the display (e;g. check that only top level questions/groups are used as dimensions)
item.summary: Subtitles in assessment

item.title: [OP-1154] Setup a translation tool
item.description:
Le système de traduction par PO n’est pas satisfaisant.
En outre, je trouve qu’il est mal utilisé.

Quand une page contient <trans>The information</trans> ..code.. <trans>is missing</trans>
Alors on se retrouve à traduire « The information » et « is missing » dans POEdit, de façon indépendante; ça donne nécessairement des résultats bizarres.

En outre, les phrase faites en anglais ne peuvent pas toujours se traduire en français ou néerlandais de façon linéaire.
Exemple <trans>This</trans>…code pour insérer le nom de la catégorie<trans>blah blah</trans>
En Poedit: This —> Ce
En anglais: This organization unit
En français: Ce unité organisationnelle

Autre exemple: <trans>New</trans> … nom de la catégorie
En néerlandais: on utilise toujours « Nieuw » tout seul, et donc dans la traduction il ne faut pas le nom de la catégorie.

C’est ridicule.
On doit passer à quelque chose de moins simpliste pour les traductions.

Il faut donc absolument:

  • introduire plus d’éléments de traduction dans le modèle (p.ex. les démonstratifs Ce/Cette)
  • que les <trans> soient réservés à des phrases complètes, statiques, sans variables, et utiliser des <blocktrans> pour les phases avec des variables, afin que l’on puisse traduire de façon correcte. Je dis ça pour les blocktrans qui sont spécifiques à Django, mais ça doit s’appliquer quelle que soit la solution retenue pour angular.
  • peut-être même qu’il faudrait pouvoir utiliser des macros qui construisent certaines phrases particulièrement complexes dans chacune des langues.
item.summary: Setup a translation tool

item.title: [OP-1144] Override configuration files
item.description:
Instead of having several complete configuration files, use a base file "opexportal.conf" and then overload the domain specific files, which will override certain configuration fields (e.g. theme)

advantage: avoid copying and maintaining the base parameters across many copies.
item.summary: Override configuration files

item.summary: Bad return link from view all page

comments.comment: Correct behaviour: stay on the page (like for documents)

item.title: [OP-1141] Assessment models must be loaded in the context of an account
item.description:
Problem:

  • Currently, an assessment model is loaded in the same version for all accounts
  • If two accounts want different versions, then they will conflict because they have the same ID

Solutions:

  1. The assessment models must be loaded within an account OR it is loaded once per version but it must be imported in an account by an admin
  2. Either the ID is adapted (by appending the account id) OR the database structure is adapted
item.summary: Assessment models must be loaded in the context of an account

comments.comment: refer to the dedicated confluence page for an description of the development steps.

item.title: [OP-1133] Hierarchy translations
item.description:
The word "subitem", "children" or "orphan" used in the tickets OP-1129 Selected for Development and following must of course not be used on the pages.

For each hierarchy there must be translations for:

  • The title on the item cards (singular and plural)
  • if necessary, the title of the item children page "sub... of <item>"
  • eventually the "back to parent item" (unless we use "back to <items>")
  • eventually in tooltips
item.summary: Hierarchy translations

item.title: [OP-1132] Item children page
item.description:
When the "View all children" button is clicked, a page opens with all direct children of the item.
This page looks exactly like the category page: an array of item cards.
Differences:

  • Below the breadcrumb, the title is "subitems of item xyz"
  • Below the title, a button to go back to the the upper level
    • The upper level may be "all items" when the parent of the item is an orphan/root item
    • Or the children page of the items's grand parent when it exists
  • When the create button is clicked, the created item is automatically a child of the current item

Example: P1 with children P1.1, P.12, with respective children P1.1.1, ... P1.2.1...
On the category page: P1, P2, etc.
On the children page of P1: P1.1, P1.2, title "subitems of P1" and the button "Back to all Ps"
On the children page of P1.1: title "subitems of P1.1" and the button "Back to P1"
item.summary: Item children page

item.title: [OP-1131] Closing item forms in the context of hierarchies
item.description:
When a user closes an item form (e.g. with the save button), the system should go back to the page the user was before. this may be:

  • the category page (with item cards) if the item has no parent
  • the "children page" of the parent item, if the item was selected from there
  • the "children page" of the grand-parent when the item form has been opened by the subitem menu on the item card of the parent item on the grand-parent page
  • in the previous cas, it may happen than the grand-parent page is in fact the root page of the category
item.summary: Closing item forms in the context of hierarchies

item.title: [OP-1130] Item cards with hierarchy
item.description:
On each item card, there is a row that indicates how many children the item has (subitems).

When the user clicks on the row, it expands to show up to 5 sub items.
For each subitem row:

  • an options button allows to:
    • show the item => open the item form (when the form will be close, it should come back to the current page)
    • remove as a child => unlink the items
  • When the subitem has also subitems a “triangle” icon that “inserts” rows with the subsubitems (slightly different background color to make a difference)
    • Only one subitem may be open at a time
  • When the subitem menu is open, the document menu should close and vice-versa
  • clicking on the name of the sub item also opens the item form
  • an additional button "show all" opens the "subitem page" (see ticket OP‌-1132)
  • an addition button "add subitem" opens a dialog where the user may select another item to be linked to the current item
    • When a subitem is added this way, the item card must be refreshed to display it in the list
    • only items that are compatible must be shown, in particular not items that already have a parent (in respect of the 1-to-many constraint)
item.summary: Item cards with hierarchy

item.title: [OP-1129] The user may structure a category in items and sub items
item.description:
The user may organize large numbers of items in hierarchies within a category.

Prerequisites:

  • The model contains a relation with target = source = category
  • That relation is one-to-many
  • The model indicates that the relation is to be used as a hierarchy

Action from the user:

  • Establish relations between the parent item and the children items

Result:

  • In the category page, the system show only "orphan" items (items that have no parent = items that are not targets of the selected relation)
  • On each item card, there is an expandable zone that lists children of the item ( see OP‌-1130)
  • For each item with children there is an "all children" page which shows only the direct children of the item (= items that are targets of the relation, when the selected item is source of the relation) (see OP‌-1132)
item.summary: The user may structure a category in items and sub items

item.title: [OP-1126] Front for documents on the category's Item List Page
item.description:
On each item card:

  1. 1 row titled "Attached documents"
    1. Nice to have: The title reflects the number of attached documents
    2. "1 Attached Document"
    3. "n Attached Documents" (if 1)
    4. "Attached Documents" (if 0)
  2. The row has an expand/collapse symbol (either +/- or caret up/down)
  3. When expanded, the card expands to as to show the attached documents
    1. The 5 most recent documents are displayed (no pagination)
    2. A (white) button "View All" below the list (left)
    3. A (blue) button "Attach Document" below the list (right)
    4. For each document, an options menu (with v-ellipsis), the options are view and delete
  4. The options menu of the card has 2 new entries, separated from the others ones by horizontal lines
    1. Attach Document
    2. View all attached documents
  5. The "View All" menus all link to the Full Document list page (see ticket)
  6. After upload: refresh the page
item.summary: Front for documents on the category's Item List Page

comments.comment: On the assessment card, the document entries in the local menu (attach + view all) should be separated from other ones by a thin line (point 4 above)

item.title: [OP-1125] Front end for documents on the Item Form page
item.description:
1. A panel titled "Attached documents" (below the diagrams)
    1. The panel displays the 5 most recent documents attached to the item
    2. For each document, there is an "Option" button (with the ellipsis icon + 'Options')
      1. The options are: view and delete
      2. Clicking the document name also views the document
    3. The panel has a "View All" (white) button on the top right to open the full list (see ticket)
    4. The panel has a "Attach document" (blue) button
    5. Nice to have: pagination within the panel
    6. Nice to have: the user may drop a document in the panel (same effect as uploading via the button)
  2. There is an "Attach Document" button on the top of the page (with + icon, see design)
    1. This button attaches the document to the item
item.summary: Front end for documents on the Item Form page

item.title: [OP-1124] "View All" Document page
item.description:
When the user clicks "View All" in a document panel, (s)he has access to a full list of all documents related to the context: assessment / item

  1. The breadcrumb indicates .../Attached Documents
  2. Each document is displayed as a mini card
  3. Info on the card
    1. Document name
    2. Document upload date
    3. Document point of attachment (for the moment, there may be only one among: an item, an assessment, a question)
  4. Buttons on the card
    1. Options (+ v-ellipsis) button with the options View and Delete
    2. delete button (trash + "Delete") + confirmation explaining that the document will be unlinked
    3. (blue) "View" button
  5. The card is also clickable => same as clicking "view"
  6. There is an "Attach Document" on top of the page => attach a doc to the item or to the assessment (not a specific question)
  7. Nice to have: the page's background allows to drop files
  8. There is a “Back to item” / “Back to assessment” button on top
item.summary: "View All" Document page

comments.comment: In the breadcrumb: “Attached Documents”

For the “view all” of assessments, the button should not be “Back to questionnaire” but “Back to assessment overview”

and go back to the assessment overview page

if there is no document, the view all page should look like the category page when there is no item: a center zone with a message:

“No Documents attached to this assessment yet

Click below to attach a document to this assessment.”

Button (with icon) to upload document.

Note: the button should be normal size, not super-wide like on the category page.

(btw: the button should be normal size on the category page as well)
After deleting a document from the “View All” page of an assessment, the system returns to the questionnaire page instead of returning to the assessment overviewpage.
On the “View all” page for an item there should be a button “Back to <category> <item name>” (similar to back to overview).

item.title: [OP-1123] Front end for documents on the Assessment Status page
item.description:
1. A panel titled "Attached documents" (below the diagrams)
    1. The panel displays the 5 most recent documents attached to the assessment OR to any question or su‌‌bquestion in the assessment
    2. For each document, there is an "Option" button (with the ellipsis icon + 'Options')
      1. The options are: view and delete
      2. Clicking the document name also views the document
    3. The panel has a "View All" (white) button on the top right to open the full list (see ticket)
    4. The panel has a "Attach document" (blue) button
    5. Nice to have: pagination within the panel
    6. Nice to have: the user may drop a document in the panel (same effect as uploading via the button)
  2. There is an "Attach Document" button on the top of the page (with + icon, see design)
    1. This button attaches the document to the assessment, not to a particular question
  3. After loading, the page self refreshes
item.summary: Front end for documents on the Assessment Status page

item.title: [OP-1122] Front for documents in the questionnaire
item.description:
Order of appearance for each question in a questionnaire:

  1. The question
  2. The response
  3. Comments
  4. The more detailed question sentence + button (not right aligned anymore)
  5. The list of attached documents, with a delete button on each (see snapshot)
  6. A button named "Attach document" that opens the browser's modal for uploading documents

After uploading the page self-saves and refreshes
item.summary: Front for documents in the questionnaire

comments.comment: Point 4 is missing: not right aligned anymore
The system uploads the documents, shows a confirmation message but the document is attached to the assessment, not to the question => it appears at the assessment level but not below the question

item.title: [OP-1121] Remove drag & drop zone from questionnaire page
item.summary: Remove drag & drop zone from questionnaire page

item.title: [OP-1120] Attribute values are saved multiple time
item.description:
The DB contains many instances of attribute-values: every time an item is saved, an instance in created instead of replacing the previous ones.

NOTE: probable impact on controls.
item.summary: Attribute values are saved multiple time

comments.comment:
For the moment, it creates an item field everytime we save the edit form of an item.
We should get the itemfield and save the new values if it exists, in the other case we should create it with the different values.
Check the method : set_attribute_value(self, attribute, value):

This will have an impact on the controls, since the controls will always try to reach the last modified itemfield. Since we only have 1 record for each itemfield, we should only get this itemfield without carrying if it's the last modified record.

!!! Be careful, doing this will gender to find a solution for the current customers that have 3 records in the DB for 1 itemfield. Considering creating a db script that removes the previous ones.

item.title: [OP-1119] The account manager may assign "member" licences
item.description:
Member licenses allow only to:

  • answer to assessments
  • modify existing items
  • upload documents
  • update existing actions

Member license are floating
item.summary: The account manager may assign "member" licences

comments.comment: See confluence page for explanation of the process

item.title: [OP-1118] The system reports on floating licenses usage
item.summary: The system reports on floating licenses usage

item.title: [OP-1117] The system controls floating licence usage
item.description:
The system counts how many users using the same license are connected.
When a user connects and reaches the maximum, a warning message appears (non blocking).
item.summary: The system controls floating licence usage

item.title: [OP-1116] The account manager may assign floating licenses
item.description:
Floating licences are licenses that may be shared by several users. There is no limit on the number of users who may share a license, only a limit on the number of simultaneous users.

Note: either a new class of licences or an attribute of modellicence class.

Possible UI: similar to named licences but every time the licence is assigned, a new unassigned line is created.
item.summary: The account manager may assign floating licenses

item.title: [OP-1115] Inconsistency in aggregations and hierarchies
item.description:
In the following situation:

  • Process 1 is subprocess of process 2
  • Process 1 belongs to OU 1
  • Process 2 is assessed
  • THEN process 2 assessment should be used to build the aggregation of OU1
  • BUT it is currently not BECAUSE recurse only recurses on the OU side

=> with hierarchies we have reached a limit of recursion in aggregations

Small fix: recurse should also recurse into the target category hierarchical relations (recurse should then allow more than one relation)

Big fix? Shouldn't we separate the concepts of aggregation and hierarchy?
item.summary: Inconsistency in aggregations and hierarchies

item.title: [OP-1114] Changing relation brings to an empty children page
item.description:
Steps to reproduce

  • Create one parent/child relation
  • Goto to the parent
  • Go to the child
  • Change the parent
  • It goes to an empty children page
  • Should go to: the children page of the new parent

In general, closing an item with parents should lead to the children page of the parent
item.summary: Changing relation brings to an empty children page

item.title: [OP-1113] The system allows to establish twice a relation
item.description:
The system should filter relations that have already been filled up to the max (ONE)

Example: The OU is already a "sub-unit of" another OU, but I can establish a second relation.
The system then shows an (ugly) error message BUT the rule should be: we don't let users do anything we know is wrong.
item.summary: The system allows to establish twice a relation

item.title: [OP-1096] Relation not displayed
item.description:
An existing relation is not displayed

  • it's connect panel is empty

See the snapshot:

UPDATE: there is no bug - the relation is “INLINE” => it is displayed, but not where I would expect to…

TODO: Inline relations must ALSO be displayed in the connection panel.

item.title: [OP-1083] Action status transitions
item.description:
The system updates the status of actions:

  • Status changes from "Idea" to "Planned" when the planned start date or the planned end date is set 
  • When status is "ongoing", the user may also indicate a progress %
  • Effective start date is set when status changes to “ongoing” (only if start date has no value yet)
  • Effective Complete date is set when status changes to “Done”
item.summary: Action status transitions

item.title: [OP-1082] Develop hierarchies as subfolders
item.description:
Goal: the system uses aggregations to display the items in a hierarchical manner.

Definitions

Suppose there is an aggregation A with relation R between items of Category C.

When Item C1 is connected to item C2 with relation R, then we say C2 is a child of C1.

Child = connected by a relation associated to an aggregation.

Changes

On the category C page, display only the orphan items = items are not children of another item (see subtask) of that category.

The items that do have children (of any category) are marked with an icon (fa-sitemap). They also have an additional button “Children”.

The children button opens a category page with only the children of that item. This must be reflected in the title of the page and the breadcrumb. The breadcrumb allows to go back to the parent item. And there is a button to go back to the parent item.

To be clear:

  • Edit(ex-View) Button => Item detail page
  • Children Button => item children page = same design as category page but only with children of that item for the selected aggregation

When there is more than 1 aggregation defined for the parent category, then the button opens a dropdown (similar to the dropdown of the “continue” button for ongoing assessments). The content of children page depends of the selected aggregation.

This is recursive when children have children.
item.summary: Develop hierarchies as subfolders

item.title: [OP-1080] The system does not prevent to break one-many cardinality
item.description:
Steps:

  • Create process A, B, C, D
  • Connect A to B with "is generic process for" (one-many) => A may have many, B may have 1
  • Connect C to B, same relation => now B has 2 generic processes instead of max 1

Correct behavior: don't put into the connection dropdown list the items that have already reached the max number of connections.
item.summary: The system does not prevent to break one-many cardinality

comments.comment:
Please explain what was done ??

Example of BAD behavior:

  • Connect process P1 to organization unit OU1 with “belongs to” (OPMM_Belong)
  • Go to OU2
  • COnnect
  • Select “contains process”
  • P1 is in the list of selectable items BUT it should not be there because belongs to is go cardinality ONE
  • WORSE: I can connect OU2 to P1 with “OPMM_Belong_reverse”
  • Then go to page of P1
  • Crash because P1 is connected to OU1 and OU2 and this conflicts with INLINE display

item.title: [OP-1068] The user may create an "action".
item.description:
From where she is, the user enters requests the creation of an “Action”, enters some information in a popup and saves.

Actions MUST be related to a workspace.

Actions MAY be related to item(s) and assessment(s).

Depending on where the user is, the action is already attached to: the current item OR the current assessment.

Note: The information may be updated later.

The information attached to an action is:

  • Title (required)
  • Description (recommended)
  • Planned dates (optional):
    • Planned start
    • Planned end
    • Planned continuation (when postponed)
  • Effective dates (optional):
    • Created
    • Started
    • Completed
  • Owner (the person who asked for it)
  • Person in charge (the person who will do it, By default the owner)
  • (optional) Team members (later: they may subscribe to changes)
  • (optional) Reminder (by default, 1 week before planned start)
  • Status (idea, accepted, planned, ongoing, done, canceled, postponed)
  • % complete (defined “by hand”)
  • Linked Items(s) or assessment(s) (recommended)
  • Task type (TBD)
item.summary: The user may create an "action".

item.title: [OP-1067] The user may create and manage improvement initiatives
item.description:
An improprement initiative is an action that the user wishes to take in order to improve the organization; an improvement initiative applies to some item (not limited in category); it should have a measurable goal related to one or more dimensions of an assessment.

Initiatives take place in the "real word", they are only tracked and monitored in the system.
item.summary: The user may create and manage improvement initiatives

item.title: [OP-1061] The system may not compare assessments of different versions
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

  • Load 2 versions of the same model and upgrade a workspace
    After the upgrade:
  • New assessments will use the new version of the questions: OK
  • Old assessments retain the old version of the questions: OK
    As a consequence:
  • The old assessments are linked to the old questionnaire id (OK)
  • The new assessments are linked to the new questionnaire id
  • It is not possible to compare old and new assessments
    => Accept to compare assessments when they have the same NAME and not when they have the same questionnaire id
item.summary: The system may not compare assessments of different versions

comments.comment: To be discussed. Using the same name causes other issues. For example, it only allows to compare assessments done on the same month (month is included in the assessment name).
The « same name «  refers to the questionnaire (the model), not the assessment.

Did you test this ?

Certainly not because it is not possible to have 2 questionnaires with the same name because of the UNIQUE constraint !

=> Discuss with Lisa how to solve this

For example:

  • drop the unique constraint (WARNING check all consequences!!)
  • add a version field and use UNIQUE(name, version)
  • keep name unique, but add another field (e.g. “model”) that will identify “similar” questionnaires, for example OPMM_OPMM and OPMM_OPMM2 could have ‘model’ equal to “OPMM” and this field might be used to allow comparison of questionnaires.

The techniques based on changing the Key do not work well because they require that all references to the questionnaire by name (e.g. in the questions) are transformed in references to the questionnaire+version (double key).

=> If we decide to do it, then use the third approach (one additional field)

item.title: [OP-1023] The system aggregates assessment results recursively
item.description:
In the model, the author may declare that a given aggregation may be recursed using a specific relation (it will always be different from the base relation).

In that case, the system will collect all items recursively.

For aggregation A between category C1 (example OU) and category C2 (example process) through relation R1 (for example belongs-to or its reverse - I don't remember).
Normally, for an item K1 of class C1, the items considered for the aggregation will be the items connected to K1 trough R1.

If a 'recurse' attribute is defined for aggregation A, with as value the relation R2, then: the system will use for the aggregation:

  • all items connected to K1 through R1 (as usual)
  • all items connected through R1 to an item connected directly or indirectly to K1 through R2

Typically, the system will collect all items connected to K1 through R2 and recursively all items connected to these items through R2. This will make a collection of items of category C1. Then the system may collect all items of category C2 connected through R1 to these items. Then the aggregation mat be done with the usual rules.

Note: R2 relates necessarily items of the same category (i.e. C1 to C1).

For the test you may create a relation suitable for R2, for example 'part-of' and its reverse 'composed-of', and use the reverse (compose-of) to connect the larger OUs to the smaller one ones.
item.summary: The system aggregates assessment results recursively

comments.comment:
NOK

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Goto questionnaire
  2. Answer some su‌bquestions to question 1, save => ok, n/m questions answered (in orange)
  3. Answer some su‌bquestions to question 2, save => ok, n/m questions answered (in orange)
  4. go to su‌bquestions of question 3
  5. answer some su‌bquestions
  6. save
  7. go again to su‌bquestions of question 3
  8. clear su‌bquestions
  9. the orange mentions “n/m questions answered have disappeared”
  10. BUT when you go to su‌bquestions of questions 2 and 3, the answers are still present

Apparently the “Clear su‌bquestions” has cleared some flags it should not…

item.summary: Keyboard shortcuts are not managed constantly

item.title: [OP-1016] At the end of an assessment sessions that seems not complete, it is difficult to identify the questions that still need to be answered...
item.description:
Original comment: You have to go through every dimension and every list... which takes time... often to discover that the ones you found and answered were not the only ones that had still to be answered...

To do: find a way to point the user to the unanswered questions.
item.summary: At the end of an assessment sessions that seems not complete, it is difficult to identify the questions that still need to be answered...

comments.comment:
To help the user find the unanswered questions easily :

1. Controls should go to the first page of the questionnaire where answers are not filled in (Already done)
2. The continue button for questionnaires should go to the first page of the questionnaire where answers are not filled in.
3. Display a text message to show the numbers of subquestions answered for a question (Example : "3/5 subquestions answered"). If all the subquestions have not been answered, changes the text color to orange to warn the user.

item.title: [OP-1015] Why, in some cases, an answer is already prefilled an not in others?
item.description: Would avoid in any case a prefilled answer...
item.summary: Why, in some cases, an answer is already prefilled an not in others?

item.title: [OP-1014] Order of processes on your screen
item.description:
The user may change the order of the items in a workspace, for example with drap-drop or up-down.
=> the system remembers, for each user and each workspace and each category, the order of the items.

Option: simply assign an order number to each item (default null) => it will be shared by all users and workspaces, but it is better than nothing...
item.summary: Order of processes on your screen

item.title: [OP-1013] When clicking on a score 1-5 you can't scroll without changing your result
item.description:
You need first to click next to the score, if you want to scroll without changing the result of your initial click (if not 5)...
Why can the result of a click not being saved, without having to push 'save' on a button underneath? Other apps work like that...
item.summary: When clicking on a score 1-5 you can't scroll without changing your result

comments.comment: Normal behaviour, to be discussed
Deactivate the keyboard arrows on the assessment question page
May require to empty the cache on safari to make it work properly.

item.title: [OP-1012] answered level 1 questions not saved
item.description:
Steps:

  • answer a level 1 question (without saving)
  • in the next question choose detailed questions which you save
  • then you will see that the first question has not been saved...

At the end - all of a sudden - you'll see that only 88% is answered due to those type of questions whose answer has not been saved...
item.summary: answered level 1 questions not saved

No issue detected, works in local or on the UAT (Probably needed to do a collectstatic). See last screenshot for current results on UAT

item.title: [OP-1010] Once 'more detailed questions' are opened, the top level question can't be answered anymore
item.description:
initial issue: When the user is curious to discover what questions he can expect underneath a top level question... he will discover that he is pushed to answer them, because the possibility to answer that top level questions has disappeared when turning back... Was that intended?

To do: allow the user to enter subquestions (for a look) and go back to main question without activating the subquestions.
item.summary: Once 'more detailed questions' are opened, the top level question can't be answered anymore

item.title: [OP-1003] Mark questionnaire as 'obsolete'
item.description:
When a questionnaire is marked as 'obsolete' (obsolete = true) it is not proposed anymore for new assessments.
usage: new versions of models with new questionnaires => old assessments still exist and reference the 'obsolete' version - but only the new version may be used for new assessments
item.summary: Mark questionnaire as 'obsolete'

item.title: [OP-1000] The system displays the date of the *indirect* assessment below the diagram on item pages
item.description:
Below the indirect assessment diagrams displayed on the item pages, in the assessment panels, the system must display effective end date of the first and last assessment used for the average (indirect).

"Questionnaires answered between <date> and <date>"
item.summary: The system displays the date of the *indirect* assessment below the diagram on item pages

comments.comment:
When first and last date are equal, use the sentence: “Questionnaire(s) answered on <date>”

instead of: Questionnaires answered between July 25, 2018 and July 25, 2018

item.description:
Below the direct assessment diagrams displayed on the item pages in the assessment panels, the system must display the effective end date of the assessment displayed.

Direct: "Questionnaire answered on <date>"
item.summary: The system displays the date of the assessment below the diagram on item pages

item.title: [OP-998] The system warns the user when aggregated assessment might be inconsistent
item.description:
The system indicates under the aggregated assessment diagram if the dates of the various assessments are too far apart (3 months).

"Warning: some assessments were conducted at very different dates, the average result is thus to be interpreted with care."
item.summary: The system warns the user when aggregated assessment might be inconsistent

item.title: [OP-997] The system indicates the number of items used for the average
item.description:
When the system displays an aggregate plot, it should indicate below the diagram how many items were used to compute the average:

  • the number of related items for which a complete questionnaire was available
  • the total number of related items

For example: "4/5 <category plural> were used to build this diagram"

If the numbers are different (= if there were related items without an assessment) then add an information (i) button with an explanation text: "Some <category plural> could not be used because they have not undergone an complete assessment. They will appear here as soon as the questionnaire has been answered."
item.summary: The system indicates the number of items used for the average

comments.comment:
1. The message should be on two lines instead of one
  2. There should be a little space between the filters and the radio buttons

item.title: [OP-996] The systems lets the user choose the aggregating relation
item.description:
If there is more than one relation that it applicable to an item category for making aggregated (indirect) diagrams, then the system displays a dropdown to choose.

  • The name of the relation appears in the drop down
  • If there is no choice, there is no dropdown and the name of the relation appears in place
item.summary: The systems lets the user choose the aggregating relation

comments.comment: In UAT, defined 2 relations and 2 aggregations, but only one appears in the list.

item.title: [OP-995] The author (of a model) may define how relations may be used for indirect assessment plots
item.description:
Not all relations may be used for indirect assessment diagrams on item pages
Only the relations that have been marked by the author
The author may indicate:

  • which relations may be used
  • which questionnaire are to be used
  • which plotter should be displayed
  • which item fields may be used for weights
  • what are the possible filters
item.summary: The author (of a model) may define how relations may be used for indirect assessment plots

item.title: [OP-994] The system allows to filter indirect assessments
item.description:
For items with no direct assessment but only indirect ones through relations.

  • If there are fields that may be used as filters, then a drop down should be displayed to allow the user to apply the filter
  • There must be an additional option 'No filter'
  • If there are no filters defined, then the dropdown must not appear
  • when the user chooses a value for a filter, the system keep only the items that have that specific field value
  • Every time the filter is changed, the system recomputes the average
  • filters and weights may be combined

The author will take care to use only multiple choice/boolean fields as possible filters.
item.summary: The system allows to filter indirect assessments

item.title: [OP-993] Indirect assessment plots use weights
item.description:
For the plots displayed on items with no direct assessment.

  • If there is an item field that may be used for weighting, then it should appear as a radio button on the diagram
  • When the user select such a radio button, the system recomputes a weighted average
    • for each question: WAVG = sum(answer * weight) / sum(weight)
  • there will thus be one or more radio buttons for weighting
  • there must be one additional radio button 'None' for no weighting (= standard average)
    • if there are no weight defined for that relation, there is no radio button at all
item.summary: Indirect assessment plots use weights

comments.comment: 1. It is not possible to reset the weighting to None

Still NOK for 2 reasons

Reason 1: The dropdown for the weight and the filter are too small for the list of choices (at least on Safari) - See snapshot

Reason 2:

if the user chooses a field for the weight AND there are some items for which the field is empty, then the picture appears in error (question) mark and a wrong message is displayed “there are no processes for that filter”

see snapshot

The correct behavior is:

display the image frame, but with a message (centered vertically and horizontally) that says:

This diagram may not be displayed because the information <filed name> is missing in <category (plural)> <item1>, <item2> and <item3>.
OK for reason 1. For reason 2, the current message (“there are no processes for that filter”) only appears when there are no items corresponding to the selected filter, to be discussed.
in the resolution of problem 2, the name of the items must be hyperlinks

For reason 2, the result achieved for now is as follows :

The new text will be displayed when only the weight field is used for filtering. The old one is still used for other cases.

This is due to some limitations :

  • The image frame only appears on Safari and, as such, it is not possible to use it to display text on other browsers.
  • Hyperlinks are not possible with the way the architecture works currently (Won't be an issue in the new one).
The sentence is wrong when there is only 1 process (see snapshot)
Also: use double quotes (“) around the name of the missing field.

item.title: [OP-992] The system display the diagram of the last *indirect* assessment on the item page
item.description:
This feature is for items for which there is no assessment defined

if there is a relation category for this item category that is suitable for aggregation
and if item A is related to one or more other items with this relations
then the system must add an assessment panel for the item and show a diagram (plot) in it.

What is on the plot:

  • the system makes an average of the results of all related items (with the aggregate relation)
  • the system uses the latest assessment of each of these items (based on "effective end date")
  • the system does not take into account the assessments that are not finished
  • the system does not take into account the items where there is no assessment for computing the average
  • the system uses the same questionnaire for all items, it does not mix questionnaires
  • if there are more than one relation suitable fo the aggregation, then the system uses the first one by default

Computation of the average

  • The system only needs the top level questions to compute the average, not all the detailed ones
  • By default, all related items have the same weight:
    • for each question: AVG = sum(answer) / N
    • N = number of items with a complete questionnaire
item.summary: The system display the diagram of the last *indirect* assessment on the item page

item.title: [OP-991] The system displays the diagram of the last *direct* assessment on the item page
item.description:
For items for which there are assessments (example: process OPMM)

In the assessment panel of the item page, insert the diagram of the latest finished assessments (using "effective end date" as reference).

If there is more than one kind of assessment, use the first one (per order of pk)
if there is more than one plotter:

  • use the first one (per order of pk) by default
  • add a radio in the diagram to let the user choose which plotter to display
    (note: this similar to what was already implemented for the "compare assessment" feature
item.summary: The system displays the diagram of the last *direct* assessment on the item page

item.title: [OP-990] A user (a consultant) may login to different accounts (his/her clients)
item.description:
The same user (= the consultant) may belong to several accounts.

Th user will log to the last used workspace of the last used account.

But there will be a “change account” menu entry allowing the user to switch account.

Important Note: as a consequence, there must be a “last used workspace” per account !

Important Note: the user must have a licence in the account to be authorized to make modifications in that account.
item.summary: A user (a consultant) may login to different accounts (his/her clients)

item.title: [OP-935] Wrong message on item controls

Modification of requirements:

  1. Click "View more detailed questions" opens a modal with the su‌bquestions
  2. The modal contains 3 buttons: cancel, save and reset
  3. Save = save the su‌bquestions, activate the su‌bquestions and deactivate the parent questions
  4. Cancel = close the window without saving the su‌bquestion; if the su‌bquestions are not yet activated, then do not activate them
  5. Reset = close the window, deactivate the su‌bquestions, reactivate the parent question

The su‌bquestions will be activated only by "Save" even if there are no answers provided.

The su‌bquestions will be deactivated by "Reset".

for consistency reasons, please replace --nargs by named parameters for all commands (see the confluence page for the list of all commands)

item.title: [OP-833] Concurrent licence model
item.description:
Instead of having named licences, the system allows a concurrent model where each licence entitles to a number of simultaneous access.

Rule 1: different types of licences grant access to different features (as it is now)
Rule 2: each user is granted one or more licences (typically when the user is created)
Rule 3 (new): the same licence may be granted to any number of users
Rule 4 (new): the system tracks the user activity and detects the active users (those who modify data)
Rule 5 (new): the system reports the average usage to the account supervisor (@opex) and the account manager (@client) the effective usage - with regular emails (configurable)
Rule 6 (new): the system alerts the managers (Opex and client) when the number of concurrent users exceeds the limit of the licences of more than X% (configurable, by Opex only) during a significant cumulated duration (configurable by Opex).
item.summary: Concurrent licence model

item.title: [OP-831] Domain specific configuration
item.description:
Instead of loading a fixed opexportal.conf, the system loads a configuration file that depends on the domain name used to connect to the server.

Advantage:

  • The style may depend on the url used
  • The db used also depends on the url used
  • Etc.
item.summary: Domain specific configuration

item.title: [OP-830] A relation may be used to display information on the item cards
item.description:
Currently, only fields may be displayed on item cards (these fields are listed in the item category)

But in the case of cardinality ONE relations, it makes sense to use relations to display information on the cards.
For example: the owner of a process.

Proposed configuration: add attributes "card_field" to relations.

  • If empty or None, the relation is not used to display anything ion the card
  • If not empty, it should contain the name of the field of the target items to display.

For example, relation "Owned by" from "Process" to "Function"
If the attribute "card_field" is "name", then then "name" field of the Function connected to each process by this relation will be displayed on the card, in the form: "Owned by": "..."

Note: if things get complicated with card fields, an option could be to use separate "card field" objects in the yaml to centralize the information to display on each category.
item.summary: A relation may be used to display information on the item cards

item.title: [OP-818] The model author may define specific PDF reports
item.description:
The author of a model may design specific reports that are integrated (at install/upgrade) in the system.

  • The system will add the specific reports to the generic reports as dropdown choices on "Report/Print" buttons when they exist
  • The system will add new "Report/Print buttons" if necessary
  • The author may define reports for:
    • printing items of a given category (or a given set of categories);
    • printing item lists (e.g. for printing through relations)
    • printing assessments using a given questionnaire (or any questionnaire in the model)

The author must conform to design guidelines determined by the template system used.

Option: the guidelines rely on an API of templatetags to access item/assessment attributes instead of directly accessing these attributes, in order to avoid dependencies on the DB structure.
item.summary: The model author may define specific PDF reports

item.title: [OP-817] Automatic combination of assessments through relations
item.description:
For items without a questionnaire linked to their category, the system will build a "virtual" assessment through relations.

The principle is that this virtual assessment will contain virtually the assessments of the items related to the first item.

Note: the word "virtual assessment" is to be taken from a functional point of view; it is not necessary that those "virtual" assessments really exist in the system. And, if they exist, they must be invisible.

Not all relations are suitable to build virtual assessments. The model must specify in the relations which ones may be used to build virtual assessments (e.g. boolean attribute auto_combine = false by default). The auto combine feature is direction specific. For example: the relation "belongs to" between processes and organization-units may be used to build the virtual assessment of an organization unit, but not the other way around.

Hence, the system must find a relation with "auto combine" in the right direction AND to a category for which a questionnaire exists in order to build virtual assessments.

If there is no such relation for that category, then there is no result panel for the items of that category.

If there is at least one relation for that category, then the system will build a virtual combined assessment with all items related to the main item with that relation add a result panel with the result of the combined assessments.

If there are related items without assessments, then the system will put a warning to mention that the result is still incomplete.

If there are no assessments yet, or not items related, then the panel will be displayed but empty, with a help messager.

If there is more than one relation, then there will be more than one virtual assessment. The result panel will display the "first" one by default (for the moment: first is somehow random). But there will be radio buttons to let the user choose which related items to display. For example, products are connected to processes that use the product and to processes that make the product. By default, the system mazy display on a product page the virtual assessment for all processes that use it, but the user may choose to display the virtual assessment of all processes that make it. The system does not need to remember that choice.

Remarks:

  • The system must display the earliest and the latest of the end dates below the result diagram and warn if they are distant of more than 3 months;
  • When items are connected to an item (and, reciprocally) when relations are removed, then the virtual assessment is updated accordingly.
  • When a questionnaire is modified for an item, then the virtual assessments must reflect the modification;
item.summary: Automatic combination of assessments through relations

item.title: [OP-816] The system displays the last result diagram on the item page
item.description:
The system displays the result diagram of the last assessment for the item.

  • If there are no assessment yet, either an empty panel OR no panel (to be decided, with a preference for an empty panel)
  • If there are more than one plotter, only the first one is used
  • The effective end date is displayed below the diagram
item.summary: The system displays the last result diagram on the item page

item.title: [OP-815] The system allows to have more than one "answer form" per assessment
item.description:
Currently, the assessments are allowed to have only one item in scope; there is thus only one questionnaire answered per assessment (one answer form). The questionnaires are linked structurally to one and only one assessment.

For the combination of assessments, the 1-1 relationship must be broken.

In the target model, there should be two notions:

  • An answer-form is the collection of answers to a given questionnaire for a given item (at a given date and by a given user)
  • An assessment is a kind of folder that contains one or more answer forms;
  • And an answer form may belong to more than one assessment.

The fields are split as follows (functionally speaking):

Assessment:

  • Planned start/end dates
  • Conclusion
  • Effective start/end : determined by the answer forms that belong to the assessment.
  • Deleted
  • global answer ratio

AnswerForm:

  • item
  • answers All answers to the questions for a given item
  • Effective start = date of answering to the first question
  • Effective end = date of answering to the last question
  • global answer ratio

Other fields:

  • Questionnaire (it is the same for all) => may be in the assessment class or in the answer form class
item.summary: The system allows to have more than one "answer form" per assessment

item.title: [OP-814] The system combines the result diagrams
item.description:
When a user has combined assessments, then:

  • The result diagram of the combined assessment is the average of the individual result diagrams;
  • The system displays on the combined assessment page the combined diagram
  • The user may choose to see one of the individual diagrams superimposed on the combined diagram
  • The system displays a combined diagram as soon as at least one individual result is available
  • If not all results are available, then the system displays a warning: "this diagram is still incomplete - some questionnaires have not yet been answered to"
  • If not result are available then no diagram is displayed
item.summary: The system combines the result diagrams

item.title: [OP-813] The user may combine several assessments in one
item.description:
The user may select several assessments and then combine them in a global assessment.

This will create a new "combined" assessment with:

  • Planned Start/end dates = earliest/latest of all sub-assessments (this fields are set when the combined assessment is created but not maintained)
  • Scope = union of the scopes of the individual assessments;
  • The answers forms of the combined assessment are the answer forms of the individual assessments => if someone modifies an answer in an individual assessment, then it is modified in the combined assessments and vice versa;
  • On the combined assessment page, the system show the individual questionnaires as if they were directly in the combined assessment, with the name of the item and the percentage of answer (and the user may click to go to the answer of each questionnaire);

Remarks:

  • For the user, there is no visible difference between combined and individual assessments
  • All individual assessment must have the same questionnaire
  • Combined assessments may also be combined together
  • When deleting an individual assessment, the questionnaire will remain in the combined assessment
  • There need to be links only between the assessments and the questionnaires, but no link between the combined assessment and the individual assessments
item.summary: The user may combine several assessments in one

comments.comment: replaced with hierarchies

item.title: [OP-809] Calculated item fields
item.description:
Item fields readonly for the user
Their value is calculated based on other fields
Examples:
A Boolean which is/true false if another field is filled in
A number counting the occurrences of multitext fields
Note: this does not need to be real fields. The goal is to display this information. An alternative would be to use a specific syntax for card fields allowing them to be: the value, the existence, the count, etc.
item.summary: Calculated item fields

item.title: [OP-808] Multi text item field
item.description:
A new type of item fields: multitext
It is basically a text field but the user may add several of them (and delete them as well)
item.summary: Multi text item field

item.title: [OP-807] Newline in model is not rendered correctly
item.description:
An explanation with newlines in the text is rendered with all text on the same line (and centered).
Note: if this is unavoidable, then we should define a code for the newline (e.g. <br>)
AND the explanation texts should be left aligned.

explanations: {
"en": "CCS CSC 1
COBIT 5 BAI09.01, BAI09.02
ISA 62443-2-1:2009 4.2.3.4
ISA 62443-3-3:2013 SR 7.8
ISO/IEC 27001:2013 A.8.1.1, A.8.1.2
NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 4 CM-8"
}
item.summary: Newline in model is not rendered correctly

comments.comment: Tooltips will now respect newlines. To make it works, add "\n" in the yaml text. See screenshot for example.

item.title: [OP-805] Stupidly translated message
item.description:
This workspace is owned by You
=> Cet espace est la propriété de Vous.

New text: This workspace is owned by: <firstname> <lastname> (You)
Nouveau texte: Cet espace est la géré par: <firstname> <lastname> (Vous)

Of course, display "(You)" only if the owner is the current user (as it is now)
item.summary: Stupidly translated message

item.title: [OP-804] Deactivating more detailed question does not really deactivate
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

  1. Enter a questionnaire
  2. Start answering question 1
  3. activate more detailed questions and start answering sub questions
  4. Deactivate more detailed questions, answer to the main question comes back OK
  5. Save and close
  6. Open again the questionnaire (continue)
  7. The more detailed questions are activated again !
    (see the screenshots (in timestamp order))

Note: the version is in fact 1.1RC15 but it does not exist in the version list.
item.summary: Deactivating more detailed question does not really deactivate

item.title: [OP-803] Edge on surface clicks twice
item.description:
Environment: Edge on a surface

  1. click to create a new item
  2. enter a new name
  3. Save
  4. The system says: there is already an item with this name
  5. Go to the list of items => The item is here
    It looks like the system tried to save the item twice

Other similar problem:

  1. Click on the "Start" button to start an assessment
  2. The system has created 2 assessment "Process xyz - March 2018" and "Process xyz - March 2018 in (2)"
    It looks like the system tried to create two assessments
item.summary: Edge on surface clicks twice

comments.comment: Both problems have been tested on Microsoft Edge and they could not be reproduced.

item.title: [OP-959] The user sends a reminder to external guests
item.description:
The user may ask the system to send a reminder to all participants who have not yet finished answering.

Only participants with incomplete answers receive the reminder
The message is different if the participant has not responded at all or if he has partially responded
item.summary: The user sends a reminder to external guests

item.title: [OP-961] The user may cancel invitations to an external collaborative assessment
item.description:
The owner of a collaborative assessment may cancel invitations of external guests (remove from the panel)

  • The right to modify the assessment is required
  • The user may cancel in one click all participants who have not yet answered
  • Confirmation required
item.summary: The user may cancel invitations to an external collaborative assessment

item.title: [OP-963] Close external collaborative assessments
item.description:
Similar to close internal assessments
When the user closes the assessment, guests may not use the link anymore to answer questions.

All links are de-activated (and point to a thank you / explanation page).
item.summary: Close external collaborative assessments

item.title: [OP-951] Guest may be categorized
item.description:
The user defines guest categories that may be used to analyze the answers.
The system will then be able to:

  • Show the overall result diagram
  • show the answers for individual participants
  • Show the answers for selected participant groups
item.summary: Guest may be categorized

item.title: [OP-953] Guest marks completeness
item.description:
In addition to saving, the guest may tell that the work is finished. This might be materialized by a "Save and continue later button" plus a "I have finished" button.

Note: If implemented, that feature should be available to internal users as well.
item.summary: Guest marks completeness

item.title: [OP-955] External guests may answer to a questionnaire
item.description:
The guest-user may click on the link provided in the email and will view only the questionnaire. The user may save answers and quit. If the guest clicks later, he will come back to the questionnaire and may continue answering.

Each link is associated to one set of answers, the guest does not have access to anything else; even if he has received several links.

It is not required that re-clicking brings exactly to where the guest was. The link will bring to the first page of the questionnaire.
item.summary: External guests may answer to a questionnaire

item.title: [OP-938] The user may select participants from the contact book
item.description:
When adding participants to a collaboration, the user may select any number of them from the contact book;
The user may filter per name, organization, tags, etc. (any field) to quickly batch-invite guests
item.summary: The user may select participants from the contact book

item.title: [OP-940] The user may manage a contact book of guests
item.description:
The user may edit the list of guests that may be invited to assessments:

  • Name, organization
  • Email
  • Tags

Editing include: insert, modify, remove
item.summary: The user may manage a contact book of guests

item.title: [OP-941] Invite multiple guests to the assessment
item.description:
The user may upload a file with the contacts of the people to be invited.
Accepted formats: text, CSV and excel.
item.summary: Invite multiple guests to the assessment

item.title: [OP-942] Invite external guests to assessment
item.description:
When the user invites people to answer a questionnaire (in the context of a collaborative assessment), she may add people who are not users of the system.
The system will send an invitation by email to all these persons.
Those guests will be identified by their emails.
item.summary: Invite external guests to assessment

item.title: [OP-945] Add participants to a collaboration
item.description: At any time, the user may add a participant who will receive an invitation email.
item.summary: Add participants to a collaboration

item.title: [OP-946] Close collaboration
item.description:
The user marks the assessment as closed and the guests may not modify their answers from that moment.

Exiting links are disabled
item.summary: Close collaboration

item.title: [OP-947] Remove a participant from the collaboration
item.description:
The user may "uninvite" someone from an assessment. As a consequence:

  • The link disappears from that person's dashboard
  • All answers from that person for that assessment are deleted
  • Existing invitation link for that person is disabled and points to a specific page
    The overall percentage of completion (and overall results) are updated accordingly

Only the owner of the assessment may do that
item.summary: Remove a participant from the collaboration

item.title: [OP-948] View the result of collaborative assessment
item.description:
The system displays the result of the assessment using an aggregation algorithm:

  • For Booleans and Multiple choices: majority of answers
  • For numeric answers: average
    The system allows to superimpose the answers of individual evaluators on the diagram.
    The report includes answers from all the evaluators.

Only complete results are taken into account

Requires the right to view the workspace to access this feature. Individual evaluators view only their own answers.
item.summary: View the result of collaborative assessment

item.title: [OP-944] Monitor the progress of the answers
item.description: The system displays the percentage of completion: how many people have finished replying, how many people are currently replying, how many people did not reply at all.
item.summary: Monitor the progress of the answers

item.title: [OP-964] The system integrates collaborative assessments in the Quality Control
item.description:
There are quality controls for:

  • the owner of the assessment (next steps, incomplete answers, etc.)
  • the participants of the assessment (pending invitations)
item.summary: The system integrates collaborative assessments in the Quality Control

item.title: [OP-967] The system integrates invitations to collaborative assessments in the notification system
item.description: In the notification system, the user will see new invitations to collaborative assessments and will be able to click to answer the questionnaire.
item.summary: The system integrates invitations to collaborative assessments in the notification system

item.title: [OP-949] A user replies to a collaborative questionnaire
item.description: The invited people will see somewhere in the platform that they have assessment to which they are invited and they may reply to the questionnaire. They are not obliged to answer to all questions at once (as for normal assessments).
item.summary: A user replies to a collaborative questionnaire

item.title: [OP-966] The system sends an invitation email to invited participants
item.description:
When a user is invited to participate in a collaborative assessment, the system sends an email to that person.
The email contains a link to the platform (but not necessarily a direct link to the assessment page)
item.summary: The system sends an invitation email to invited participants

item.title: [OP-950] The user initiates a collaborative assessment
item.description: The user may notify that the assessment is collaborative by checking the "multiple evaluation" box in the assessment definition. The user must then invite the people who will participate in the assessment.
item.summary: The user initiates a collaborative assessment

item.title: [OP-937] The user invites external guests to participate to a collaborative assessment
item.description: The user invites external guests (id'ed by their email) to a collaboration; the system sends them an email
item.summary: The user invites external guests to participate to a collaborative assessment

item.title: [OP-924] The interface allows to see a full list of controls.
item.description:
On a new page, the system displays a list of all the controls in the system. From this list, a user can choose to :
-Go to the page where the control needs to be done
-Postpone the control until a certain time (Choosing from a pre defined list)
-Reassign to a new user

item.title: [OP-929] The interface allows to see a condensate list of controls.
item.description:
On the dashboard, the systems displays a summary list of the 6 highest priority controls to do in the system. A tooltip may be needed to give more informations about the control. From this list, a user can choose to :

  • Go to the page where the control needs to be done
  • Postpone the control until a certain time (Choosing from a pre defined list) (UWS13
  • Reassign to a new user (see UWS12)
  • Add a comment to the control (UWS14)
item.summary: The interface allows to see a condensate list of controls.

item.title: [OP-915] The user may postpone a control task
item.description: The user may postpone a control until a certain date. The user doesn't enter a date but choose to postpone the control for a certain time from a list (Remind me in a week, month,...) or can even ask to be never reminded of the control. A postponed control won't appear on the dashboard control's list but will appear in the full control list.
item.summary: The user may postpone a control task

item.title: [OP-916] Modify user responsible for control
item.description: The user may change the user assigned to a control. By default, the user assigned to it is the one who created the control by creating a new item or a new assessment. The control doesn't need to have an history of each user who had the control assigned, only the current one.
item.summary: Modify user responsible for control

comments.comment: The user name should be in black, grey is not visible enough

item.title: [OP-910] Complete controls from the list
item.description: The user may go to the page needed to complete a control. A control checking missing item fields on an item must redirect to the item edit page. A control checking answered fields in an assessment's questionnaire must redirect to the first page of the questionnaire where a question is unanswered.
item.summary: Complete controls from the list

item.title: [OP-911] Display control details
item.description: The user may see the details of a control by clicking on a control's name. The user is redirected to a new page where all the details of the control are listed(status, postponed date if there is one, ...)
item.summary: Display control details

comments.comment: A modal is preferred rather than a separate page

item.title: [OP-912] Cancelling controls on assessment deletion
item.description: When a user deletes an assessment, the system may need to cancel the controls related to an assessment depending on its previous status (A closed control doesn't need to be cancelled).
item.summary: Cancelling controls on assessment deletion

item.title: [OP-913] Updating controls of assessments
item.description:
When a user answers a question in an assessment's questionnaire or the user activates subquestions for one or more questions, the system may need to update the status of the control:
If a question is answered, the system must check if all the questions are answered and closes the control if it's the case.
If subquestions are activated for a question and the control is closed, its status must be change to "Open".

The controls must also be updated when assessment status is changed or when the user postpones a control (e.g : Status changes and postponed date)
item.summary: Updating controls of assessments

item.title: [OP-917] Creating assessment control
item.description: When a user creates a new assessment, the system creates a control in charge of checking if all the questions in an assessment's questionnaire have been answered.
item.summary: Creating assessment control

item.title: [OP-918] Cancelling controls on item deletion
item.description: When a user deletes an item from a workspace, the system needs to change the control status to "Cancelled" of all the active controls (Status "Open") associated with the item.
item.summary: Cancelling controls on item deletion

item.title: [OP-919] Updating control on item modifications
item.description:
When a user modifies an item and fills in or removes informations, the system update the controls related to it:

  • if the user has completed all fields/questions related to the control, then the control is closed;
  • otherwise the control remain open;
  • A closed controls might need to be reopened if the user removes some informations from an item.
item.summary: Updating control on item modifications

item.title: [OP-792] The user should be able to create a relation from the item list
item.description:
Create an item when selecting a target :
if there is only one required field, create it immediatly in the dropdown
if there is more that one required field, add a popup with the different field to fill in
item.summary: The user should be able to create a relation from the item list

comments.comment: selectize add element with name and use it is the dropdown
Only ask the name (= the field 'identifier' of the category)

done for target in the modal

      • need to find a solution when duplicates

Technically OK
But

  1. When there is no item of the target category, then add to the message "... OR type the name of a new <category> to connect to this <category>"
  2. When there are items of the target category, it is anyway possible to create a new item (good), but this also should be documented: "Select an element from the list or type the name of a new <category> to connect to this <category>"
  3. If the user tries to recreate a relation that already exists, then the message should be "These elements are already connected"
  4. If the user creates two instance of a "one" relation, the error message is displayed full screen instead of a popup (screen shot)
  5. In that case, the message should be: "This <category> is already to connected to a <category>, only one such relation is allowed - if this is your goal, then delete the existing connection before making a new one"

Other issue: the new item has "None" as value of some fields (instead of empty fields)
See the snapshot:

  • An OU created manually: the unit type is empty (good)
  • An OU created automatically: the unit type is None (bad)

Work around: do not tidy the figure and keep axis tiles short

item.title: [OP-783] Define a procedure to re-load a modified, overwriting existing questions, titles, names, categories, relations, etc.
item.description:
Currently, reloading a model does not modify it. All existing categories, questions, etc. are not updated; only new ones are uploaded.

Expected behavior:

  • When a category is updated, the system must update:
    • icon
    • translations, explanations, plurals
  • When a Field Choice is updated, the system must update:
    • only translations, explanations, plurals
  • When a Field Category is updated, the system must update:
    • importance
    • order
    • translations, explanations, plurals
  • When a Questionnaire is updated, the system must update:
    • only translations, explanations, plurals
  • When a MultipleChoce is updated, the system must update:
    • only translations, explanations, plurals
  • When a Question is updated, the system must update:
    • presentation
    • weight
    • min_value
    • max_value
    • exclude_zone
    • icon
    • color
    • translations, explanations, plurals
  • When a Plotter is updated, the system must update:
    • chart
    • color
    • translations, explanations, plurals
  • When a PlotAxis is updated, the system must update:
    • only translations, explanations, plurals
    • translations, explanations, plurals
  • In general, for all objects that are translatable, the system must update:
    • translations
    • explanations
    • plurals
item.summary: Define a procedure to re-load a modified, overwriting existing questions, titles, names, categories, relations, etc.

comments.comment:
Code to save only some attributes of model (to add in the save() method):
{{
old = Question.objects.get(key=self.key)
old.translations = self.translations
old.explanations = self.explanations
super(Question, old).save(*args, **kwargs)
}}

The system should prevent any other modification of attributes.
AND this applies to the YAML file as a whole.
=>

  1. if the yaml modifies any other field, then raise an error (indicating which field)
  2. the error will interrupt the upload
  3. use atomic mode to force Postgres to rollback

Or any equivalent solution

item.title: [OP-879] Configure the logging system
item.description:
• Based on Django logging system, configured in settings.py
  • Activated/disabled in opexportal.conf (using loglevel = None, Debug, INFO, etc.)
  • Compatible with Apache logs => don't reinvent the wheel

Optionally:

  • define an additional handler that sends an email to support when a CRITICAL bug took place.
  • send a daily mail with an extract of the log to support

usage:

  • Log specific events in the appllication
  • Log forbidden behavior
  • Debug in production/uat: it sill be easy to add lines of log on the production source code to see what goes wrong
item.summary: Configure the logging system

item.title: [OP-769] When creating or editing an item, the field marked as "identifier" in the category *must* be entered
item.description:
In the current state, I can create a process with no name...

Approach:

  • Replace the field "required" (bolean) with another field "requirement" in the class fieldcategory
  • the type of requirement is Charfield with a limited set of values
  • RQT_LIST = (
    (FieldValueType.REQUIRED, "Required"),
    (FieldValueType.IMPORTANT, 'Important'),
    (FieldValueType.RECOMMENDED, 'Recommended'),
    (FieldValueType.OPTIONAL, 'Optional')
    )
  • In the forms, the field will be required if the value of "requirement" is "Required"
item.summary: When creating or editing an item, the field marked as "identifier" in the category *must* be entered

comments.comment: field is called importance

item.title: [OP-759] "tags" field type
item.description:
The tags field type allows users to enter keywords in a field (same as 'components' in Jira)

  • The user simply adds words in a text field
  • The user may click on a cross to remove a word
  • The tags must not be defined in advance by an admin or by a user
  • The tags do not require a management interface to define, modify or delete them
  • Option: when the user types a keyword, the system proposes a list of existing keywords (= keywords used in the same field of other items of the same category in the same workspace)
item.summary: "tags" field type

item.title: [OP-728] Assessment models must be loaded in the context of an account
item.description:
Problem:

  • Currently, an assessment model is loaded in the same version for all accounts
  • If two accounts want different versions, then they will conflict because they have the same ID

Solutions:

  1. The assessment models must be loaded within an account OR it is loaded once per version but it must be imported in an account by an admin
  2. Either the ID is adapted (by appending the account id) OR the database structure is adapted
item.summary: Assessment models must be loaded in the context of an account

item.summary: Bug with OPMM5

comments.comment:
The OPMM5 questionnaire is in OPMM5.yaml in hotfix/OPMM5.

The yaml contained only the questionnaire => the OPMM.yaml file must be loaded anyway

item.summary: Delete process with assessments raises a error 500

comments.comment: Same problem after I delete the assessment

item.title: [OP-719] In compare form, mention that incomplete and incompatible assessments are not displayed
item.summary: In compare form, mention that incomplete and incompatible assessments are not displayed

item.title: [OP-718] Left panel incorrect while in user settings
item.description:
Problem: in settings page, the left panel should show the list of administrative options, but it shows the standard Organization/Assessment panel.
See snapshot.
item.summary: Left panel incorrect while in user settings

comments.comment: it was a problem with cache, I removed it
I still have the problem

item.title: [OP-717] New assessment does not refresh the left navigation panel
item.description:
Steps:

  1. Create New Assessment by clicking on bottom left white button
  2. Edit and save properties
  3. Assessment is created but it is not displayed under "Assessments" in the left panel (see snapshot)

The second assessment remains invisible even after logout/login and even after quit/restart Safari.
item.summary: New assessment does not refresh the left navigation panel

comments.comment: Ce qui est bizarre c'est que j'ai fini par avoir les bonnes pages après deux resets d'apache.
The bug goes both ways: when I delete an assessment, it remains in the left panel.

There is already another ticket for that.
I removed the cache on the menu
It will be corrected in 1.1RC2

item.title: [OP-711] group question answers are computed after homogenizing subquestions
item.description:
For questions that are computed as an average value (and geometric average as well).
The formula is:

  • use sub_answers . as_percentage (instead of raw values) to compute the average
  • in the average use weights => sum values x weights (instead of only values)
  • divide by the sum of weights to get the average
  • the final value is adjusted to the groups' min/max value

If values are v[i], with weights w[i] then:

  • average = sum (v[i] * w[i]) / sum(w[I])
  • result = average * (max_value - min_value) + min_value
item.summary: group question answers are computed after homogenizing subquestions

comments.comment: Apply this formula for each type of answer (for the moment it's only for numeric questions)

item.title: [OP-686] Start assessment from the item card
item.description:
On the item card, add a button to start/continue/view assessments

  1. More the creation date to the card middle zone
  2. Add a button on the card, left of the "view" button
    1. If there is no open assessment in the workspace with this item in the scope
      • The button is "Start Assessment"
      • it creates a new assessment, as on the item detail view
    2. If there is one open assessment (and only one)
      • The button is "Continue Assessment"
      • it goes to the questionnaire for this item in the assessment, as on the item detail view
    3. If there is more than one open assessment
      • The button is "Assessments..."
      • Click opens a model box with the list of open assessments in the workspace that contain this item in the scope
      • On each line of the box, a button allows to:
        • "start" the new/planned assessments
        • "continue" the ongoing assessments
        • "results" of the finished assessments
        • "resume" the postponed assessments
      • if there are also closed assessments, then add a line "All assessments..." that simply goes to the item detail page

Open assessment : new, planned, ongoing, postponed or finished
Not open: closed, canceled
item.summary: Start assessment from the item card
