item.title: [OP-684] On the assessment card, add 'start/continue' button
item.description:
On the assessment card:

  • Rename the 'Complete' button to 'Properties' and change color to white
  • Add a button to start/continue the assessment. The button will send the user to the first page of the first incomplete questionnaire, if any:
    • if assessment answer rate = 0 (nothing started):
      • The name of the button is "Start"
      • The button goes to the questionnaire for the first item
    • if assessment answer rate > 0 and < 1 (started but incomplete):
      • The name of the button is "Continue"
      • The button goes to the questionnaire for the first incomplete item, with a priority for item-questionnaires already started
        • If there is an item with answer 0 < rate < 1, select it
        • otherwise select an item with rate = 0
    • If answer rate = 1
      • The name of the button is "Result"
      • The button shows the results (assessment result page with diagram opened)
item.summary: On the assessment card, add 'start/continue' button

item.description:

  2. The user may click to go to the assessment
  3. if there is an ongoing assessment, add a button to continue this assessment
  4. if there is no ongoing assessment, add a button to start a new one;
    • the name of the new assessment will be the name of the item + the month and year
    • The scope of the assessment will be the item
    • The questionnaire will be automatically selected if possible:
      • If there is only one questionnaire for this category, select it
      • otherwise a popup asks for the questionnaire
    • Planned start, effective start = today
    • Planned end = + 1 month
    • Status = ongoing
    • The user goes directly to the questionnaire

item.title: [OP-674] Graphical representation of the spider diagram
item.description:
Some more esthetically intended suggestions:

  • the diagram shown should be 'smaller'
  • the words should be larger (better readable)
  • the diagram-lines should be 'thicker' (see 2 examples --> can we represent ours a bit in this style??)
  • The overall result should be a thick line without fill, and should not be gray
  • we talk about 4 perspectives, but this notion is nowhere recuperated and interpreted in our graphic... I believe it is desirable to group the dimensions and to indicate them (each in a specific colour or by mentioning it under the indicator in parentheses)
item.summary: Graphical representation of the spider diagram

item.title: [OP-661] Missing confirmation popup when deleting workspace with delete button

The confirmation popup "are you sure ..." appears only when clicking on the card menu in "My workspaces".

item.summary: Missing confirmation popup when deleting workspace with delete button

item.title: [OP-660] Define a consistent rule for deleting items in cascade (or not) when a workspace is deleted
item.description:
Currently, when a workspace is deleted

  • non shared items are left as is (hence hanging with a deleted home workspace)
    • they are thus not accessible (not an issue) and will be restored when the workspace is undeleted (good)
  • shared items are moved to another home workspace (acceptable)
  • no information about this to the user

Action:

  • add a confirmation popup that will mention to the user the consequences of deleting the workspace
    OR
  • replace 'delete workspace' with 'archive workspace' ; the difference being that archived workspaces are cleary only hidden, and that will items from archived workspaces become readonly but remain in any other workspace or assessment where they already are
item.summary: Define a consistent rule for deleting items in cascade (or not) when a workspace is deleted

item.title: [OP-626] Allow field type to be an item (of a given category)
item.description:
Example:
Category: process
Field name: owner
Field Type: [Role]

For filling the field: a drop down with the target items' identifier fields
For displaying it: the selected item's identifier field plus a link to the item
item.summary: Allow field type to be an item (of a given category)

comments.comment:
Reformulation of requirement:

If a relation is of cardinality ONE

AND if the relation is marked as "INLINE" (presentation field in the model/yaml)

THEN instead of displaying the relation in the relation panel, the relation is displayed as a dropdown with the item fields.

1. ok only in the happy case
  2. the dropdown does not show the current value (it is empty even if there is a value) - snapshot
  3. if there is no item of the target category, then saving causes an error 500 (for example, "belongs to" is inline but there is no "function")
  4. the same relation may be created many times (I guess every time the user saves)
  5. if the user changes the value, a new relation is created but the previous one is not deleted
    1. example: added many items ("functions") while inline
    2. removed "inline" => proof that the cardinality ONE is filled by many instances
The current value is not displayed

item.title: [OP-622] Delete process does not delete the process
item.description:
Steps:

  1. Create process
  2. Create assessment for that process
  3. Delete the assessment
  4. Delete the process => does nothing

Hypothesis: this is because the process is still linked with the assessment
Correct behaviour:

  1. Accept to delete and item linked with a deleted assessment
  2. If the item is linked with an (non deleted) assessment, don't delete it BUT display a message "You may not delete this item because it is used in the assessment '<assessment>'"
item.summary: Delete process does not delete the process

item.title: [OP-598] redesign workspace access rights page
item.summary: redesign workspace access rights page

comments.comment: The list of rights is not understandable by "normal" users: just leave "allow reading" and "allow modification"

Tooltip "Read": this user will have the right to consult all items and assessments, but not to make any modification

Tooltip "Write": this user will have the right to modify the information associated to all elements, add and remove elements and answer assessments.

Tooltip "Admin": this user will have the right to write (see above) plus the possibility to grant access to other users.

Create a list with all user of the account
On each line show : firstname, lastname, email, 3 buttons on the right "read", "write", "manage workspace"
Please place the User and the permissions on the same line (and keep this correctly aligned if different users have names of different lengths)

It is not possible to give READ access to a user who has no licence. This is not right: users without a licence may have a read access. Users with a licence may have read or write access.

Please refer to https://opexalliance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/OP/pages/5406721

Eventually check if this page and/or subpages are not up to date, and mention it to the authors.
Last comment still NOK: it must be possible to grant a read access to a user without a licence

item.title: [OP-571] Combine assessments
item.description:
Allow the user to combine assessments.

  1. Select one or more compatible assessments (similar to compare).
  2. Assessments must all have the same questionnaire
  3. They do not need to be completed
  4. When the user has selected the assessment she click on 'combine' and then a pop up is displayed to:
    1. ask the name of the merged assessment
    2. check if the elementary assessments must be deleted or kept anyway
  5. Create a new assessment with:
    1. scope = union of all scopes
    2. questionnaire = same as all selected assessments
    3. start dates = earliest of all start dates
    4. end dates = latest of all start dates
item.summary: Combine assessments

comments.comment: Canceled because we will stick to single item scopes. Merging makes thus no sense per se => it will be used for reporting purpose only.

Fifrefox

item.title: [OP-544] Login error if workspace access has been revoked
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

  1. Create 2 users and 2 workspaces, WS1 and WS2,
  2. user 1 is owner of WS1, user 2 is owner of WS2
  3. user 1 grants access to user 2 to WS1
  4. User 2 visits WS1 and logs out
  5. user 1 revokes access of user 2 to WS2
  6. User 1 logs out
  7. Use2 logs in => error 500
    Cause: the last visited workspace of U2 is WS1 => no access

Expected: if a use has no access to the last visited, then don't use the last visited
item.summary: Login error if workspace access has been revoked

comments.comment: If the user has no access to the last workspace visited, then the system throws a 403 error message at login instead of redirecting to another workspace.

J'ai testé :

Scénario 1:

1. Aurelien donne view à WS 1
2. Tania se connecte et accède au dashboard
3. Aurelien supprime les permissions de Tania
4. Tania se connecte et accède bien aux settings

Scénario 2:
1. Aurelien donne view à WS 1 et WS
2. Tania se connecte à WS 1 et accède au dashboard
3. Aurelien supprime les permissions de Tania sur WS 1
4. Tania se connecte et accède bien au WS S2

Je n'ai pas réussi à reproduire le problème

item.title: [OP-542] Users wish dual-model workspaces
item.description:
Users might not enter into the complexity of workspaces. In particular, the idea of having separate workspaces for separate tasks might seem inconvenient.
A user with 2 licences might wish to put everything in the same workspace.

In fact, there are several usages of workspaces:

  • The personal workspace of a user where he may collect his work (it seems a "natural" usage, but in practice this corresponds to the login space of the user);
  • The decomposition of the organisation in separate units;
  • The decomposition of the work into separate models;
item.summary: Users wish dual-model workspaces

item.title: [OP-541] Hide result button overlaps with report button on assessment page
item.summary: Hide result button overlaps with report button on assessment page

item.title: [OP-540] Users may import from workspaces even if they don't have access :-(
item.description:
Steps:

  1. Create a workspace
  2. Create a process
  3. Don't give access to anyone
  4. Logout
  5. Login as another user
  6. Go to process
  7. import
  8. The process is displayed in the list BUT it should not
item.summary: Users may import from workspaces even if they don't have access :-(

  • extendlicence --nargs licensecode [new_end_date]

+ add natural key on account if not precised use company name.

item.title: [OP-537] Administrators have access to all workspaces
item.description:
Administrator must not have more access than other users.
They must not have read/write access by default to any workspace
They must be granted a permission like any other user

Consequence: when an administrator logs in but has no access to no workspace, the admin should be sent directly to the settings page
item.summary: Administrators have access to all workspaces

comments.comment:
Solution:

  1. force superuser =false in User.save
  2. Create permission account_admin (or better name) who has access to settings mage
  3. the account admin may log in even if he/she has no access to no workspace => go directly to admin pages

item.title: [OP-536] Rename the 'cancel' button on workspace permissions to 'Back to the workspace'

But cancel will be interpreted as "cancel the changes"
=> rename the button
item.summary: Rename the 'cancel' button on workspace permissions to 'Back to the workspace'

item.title: [OP-535] A user who is owner of a workspace may not login
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

  1. Create a user (yaml or load permissions)
  2. Set the user as owner of a workspace (workspace yaml or direct db)
  3. The user may not login (no message)

Problem 2:

  1. Set the last_workspace_visited of the user to the workspace of which he is owner (direct db)
  2. Login
  3. Error 403 no access to the page
    Apparently the user is owner but has no access !!
item.summary: A user who is owner of a workspace may not login

comments.comment: Complementary test: insert a permission in guardian_userobjectpermission => now the user has access
Solution: workspace.save will grant necessary access to owner

item.title: [OP-534] Once a user has been granted access to a workspace, the navigation panel changes to a wrong panel
item.description:
Reproduce:

  1. Go to Workspaces properties
  2. The left panel contains Properties and Permissions
  3. Go to permissions
  4. Add a user
  5. The page is now "Manage User Permissions"
  6. The left navigation panel now contains "My Profile", "Change password", etc. = WRONG
    The navigation panel should remains the workspace properties panel
item.summary: Once a user has been granted access to a workspace, the navigation panel changes to a wrong panel

item.title: [OP-533] if there are no permissions granted on a workspace, the system must show it on the workspace permissions page
item.description:
Currently: is no permissions were granted to a workspace, then the page simply displays "Add users"

Expected behavior:

  1. Before "add users", insert a line mentioning that no permissions were granted
  2. Change the "Add users" title to "Grant access to you colleagues"
  3. Change the "Add users" button to "Grant Access"
item.summary: if there are no permissions granted on a workspace, the system must show it on the workspace permissions page

item.title: [OP-532] When a user has access to no workspace, the login fails without any message
item.description:
Reproduce:

  1. Create a user (with yaml and/or load permissions)
  2. Do NOT give access to any workspace
  3. Login with that user
  4. apparently nothing happens

Expected behavior: warning message
item.summary: When a user has access to no workspace, the login fails without any message

comments.comment:
Expected behavior:

  1. The user without workspaces goes to his settings/workspaces page
  2. This page must contain a blue panel with the message: "This page lists all the workspaces you own or to which you have access".
  3. if user has no licenses and access to no workspaces, add the message: "You currently have been granted access to no workspace and you don't have a licence to create one. Please contact your administrator"
  4. if user has access to no workspace but has at least one licence, add the message: "You currently have been granted access to no workspace and have not create your own either. You may always create a new workspace by clicking on the home button in the top left navigation panel."
  5. if the user has licences, add the message: "You have been granted the the right to create workspaces for the following models: [licence name] [create workspace button] <br>..."

item.title: [OP-529] The system loads server specific configuration at startup
item.description:
In settings.py, load the configuration file /usr/local/etc/opexportal.conf and use the data in it to initialize global variables.

if the file does not exist, the application stop.

The format of the file is defined by the library "configparser":

https://docs.python.org/3.6/library/configparser.html

[general]
debug = False

[network]
allowed_hosts = localhost 127.0.0.1 .opexalliance.com opexportal .local

[database]
name = opex
user = opex
host = localhost
password = password

Usage= (for example)

Debug = cfg.getboolean('general', 'debug', False)
item.summary: The system loads server specific configuration at startup

item.title: [OP-517] Write access to workspaces is conditioned by a licence
item.description:
• the user may receive write access to a workspace but will not be allowed to make (or save) changes if he does not have an active licence for the workspace's model;
  • the user may not modify items shared with workspaces if she has no licence for the other workspace's model
  • the above rule applies both to imported items (import from ws) and shared items (shared by the owner of the workspace with this user).
  • if the user loses the licence, the write access is still memorized but suspended so that when the licence is reactivated, the user has again a write access;
item.summary: Write access to workspaces is conditioned by a licence

item.title: [OP-516] *Create workspace*: list of models filtered by the user licences (models without an active licence are grayed out);
item.description:
when the user creates a workspace, he/she must select a model.

  • Only models for which the user has an active licence may be selected.
  • models for which there is a licence in the account are grayed
  • models for which there is no licence in the account are not displayed
item.summary: *Create workspace*: list of models filtered by the user licences (models without an active licence are grayed out);

item.title: [OP-515] Create workspace: access to the page refused without an active ModeLicence (any model);

item.title: [OP-514] Create workspace: access to the page refused without an active ModeLicence (any model);
item.description: When the user clicks to create a workspace, then the system will refuse to do so, and display a red banner is the user has 0 active Model licences.
item.summary: Create workspace: access to the page refused without an active ModeLicence (any model);

  2. the user logs in
  3. Creates a workspace
  4. Error 404
normal behaviour should be : the button should be disabled if there is no more licence with a tooltip explaining why.

item.title: [OP-513] Category fields must be required/optional depending on the category
item.description:
Currently, the fields are required/optional by themselves => they are required/optional in all categories that use them.
BUT the "optionality" of fields should depend on the category => the declaration must be in the category.
item.summary: Category fields must be required/optional depending on the category

comments.comment: Not urgent. That would require to dramatically change the yaml structure => wait until we have an alternative for editing models.
Not required anymore since fields are now defined per category

item.title: [OP-511] On item cards, display only the fields of the current model
item.description:
Currently, the system does not filter the fields displayed on the item cards.
But only fields defined in the model of the current workspace should be displayed.

For example:

  • in OPMM, "process type" is a card field;
  • in GDPR, "privacy sensitive" is a card field;
    Currently: both fields are displayed on the card (wrong)
    => in a OPMM workspace, only "process type" must appear
    and in a GDPR workspace, only "privacy sensitive" must appear
item.summary: On item cards, display only the fields of the current model

item.title: [OP-510] Explanations to answers in assessments must not prevent from saving the questionnaire form
item.description:
Currently, if explanations are marked as mandatory in the model, then the questionnaire form may not be saved if the field is left empty.
However, users should have the choice to fill in explanations later.
=> the field must not be required at the HTML level
item.summary: Explanations to answers in assessments must not prevent from saving the questionnaire form

item.title: [OP-466] Deleting a workspace leaves orphan items
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

  • Select a workspace with items
  • Delete the workspace
  • The home workspace of the items is now the deleted workspace

Correct behaviour: to be defined
item.summary: Deleting a workspace leaves orphan items

comments.comment: popup pour confirmer la suppression s’il y a des items. Dans le message, préciser s’il en existe qui sont partagés (juste le mentionner, pas les lister)

Steps:

  1. create workspace
  2. create item
  3. delete workspace

Result

  • workspace is deleted
  • item is not deleted
  • item's home workspace is the deleted workspace

We may accept the above behavior.
BUT

  1. Create workspace WS3
  2. Create item
  3. Share item with other workspace WS1
  4. Delete WS1
  5. Item is not deleted
  6. Item is still shared
  7. BUG Home workspace of item is still WS3
  8. BUG Item appears in WS1 as shared with WS3
  9. BUG The user may click on the link to WS3 and go to WS3 even if the workspace has been deleted!

you probably meant for step 4 :"delete WS 3" ?

it not a simple "bug" but multiple tasks to do when we delete a workspace.

We need to discuss about this.

Accepted to remain as is: not deleting the items allows to undelete the workspace and retrieve the situations as it was before the ws was deleted.

The filters are in place to prevent importing a non-deleted item from a deleted workspace.

item.title: [OP-452] The user may delete a Workspace
item.description:
The user may delete a workspace.
The user needs access rights (to be defined) to do so.

Before deleting, the system checks if there are items that are shared with other workspaces. In that case, a page is presented to the user with the list of shared items (and in which workspaces they are) and the possibility to indicate for each of them:

  • if the item must be remove from all other workspaces
  • if the item home workspace must be changed

The user may bulk select items before proceeding.

As for items, the workspace is not deleted but only marked as deleted.

Workspaces marked as deleted do not appear anymore in menus like: changing workspace, importing and exporting items, etc.
item.summary: The user may delete a Workspace

item.title: [OP-451] Users may edit fields of imported items only if they have write access to the home workspace of the item
item.description:
The current behavior is incorrect:
1) the users has read access to a ws
2) the user imports an item
3) the user may modify the item ! (maybe not all fields, but he can modify anyway)

Secondly the current behavior is frustrating:
1) A user has write access to a workspace B (=> he has a licence for the model of B)
2) the user imports an item in workspace A with model A
3) He can't modify the fields inherited from model B even with the licence and the write access

Thirdly, there is a business need:
For example, the person responsible of GDPR would like to buy GDPR licences for all Process analysts, so that they may fill in the GDPR fields at the same time they document their processes.
item.summary: Users may edit fields of imported items only if they have write access to the home workspace of the item

item.title: [OP-438] Fields may be required or optional
item.description:
The model defines if a category field is required (must have a value) or not.

a) in the CategoryField models, add an attribute "required" that determines is a value is required field;
b) in the form, mark the field as required if the attribute "required" is True and control that the field has a value EXCEPTED when the field is disabled because it belongs to another model that the workspace

In the future we will add on the dashboard a list of items with missing required values.
item.summary: Fields may be required or optional

item.title: [OP-437] The 'required' nature of a category field must be defined in the category, not in the field
item.description: In the resolution of OP-436 Done , a "required" attribute has been added to fields. It should be added to the "link" between the Category and the CategoryField. Indeed, the fact that a field is mandatory or not may depend on the category.
item.summary: The 'required' nature of a category field must be defined in the category, not in the field

comments.comment: Fields will be defined within the category - no more field sharing across categories => the requirement is useless

item.title: [OP-436] Fields from other models prevent from creating new items
item.description:
Steps to reproduce the bug:
1) If an item category C is defined in two models M1 and M2
2) if category field F is defined for C in M2 only
3) if current workspace is in M1
4) then when one creates an item of category C, then the item may not be saved because the field is write-protected (because it is from the other model)
item.summary: Fields from other models prevent from creating new items

comments.comment: Resolution (Temporary): in the form and the DB, all fields are nullable (no value required)
Une solution plus évoluée est décrite dans OP-438 Done , une solution encore meilleure est dans OP-437 Canceled
Bug not solved: you need to change the default value of 'required' to False in the FieldCategory model

item.title: [OP-435] The system does not allow to create an item from mixed models

=> impossible to save

item.title: [OP-434] The system does not accept the value false for Boolean fields
item.description:
If an item field is boolean, and if it is not checked, then the system believes that it is not set.
Because the field must be set, the system refuses to save the item.
item.summary: The system does not accept the value false for Boolean fields

comments.comment:
Replace the checkbox by a yes/no toggle
in the item property field
=> booleans may be true, false or unknown
(see if django allows to define a 3-valued boolean)

item.title: [OP-426] Provide multiple value fields allowing the users to select one or more values from a list
item.description:
Create a new attribute for category fields: multiple (boolean).

When a field is multiple, the user may specify more than one value for that field.

This is applicable only to CHOICE fields.
item.summary: Provide multiple value fields allowing the users to select one or more values from a list

comments.comment:
As a consequence, the "value" attribute of the fields must become an array.

Alternatively, use "values" instead of "value" and redefine "value" as an @property that returns values[0].

item.title: [OP-425] After login, the system tries to load Workspace with id=1, even if it does not exist
item.summary: After login, the system tries to load Workspace with id=1, even if it does not exist

item.title: [OP-424] loadddata OPMMExample does not work anymore
item.description:
django.db.utils.IntegrityError: Problem installing fixtures: insert or update on table "landscape_item" violates foreign key constraint "landscape_item_ws_created_by_id_495a8fca_fk_workspace"
DETAIL: Key (ws_created_by_id)=(1) is not present in table "workspace_workspace".
item.summary: loadddata OPMMExample does not work anymore

comments.comment:
C'est à cause du fait que quand on fait des tentatives infructueuses, le générateur d'id est quand même incrémenté et donc les id des workspaces ne sont pas forcément 1 ou 2
=> ne pas se baser sur des id dans les fixtures mais sur une clé (natural key)

item.title: [OP-367] Some access rights depend on a licence
item.description:
In the computation of access rights, some actions like for example modifying a workspace, require a licence in addition to the usual rights.

  • Create workspace: access to the page refused without an active ModeLicence (any model);
  • Create workspace: list of models filtered by the user licences (models without an active licence are grayed out);
  • Write workspace: the user may receive write access but will not be allowed to make (or save) changes if he does not have an active licence for the workspace model;
  • Note: the above also applies for items shared from other workspaces;
item.summary: Some access rights depend on a licence

item.title: [OP-366] When deleting a shared item from its primary workspace, the user may choose to remove from the workspace instead of delete
item.description:
The choice is between:

  • remove the entity from this workspace (will remain in other workspaces) and choose another primary workspace
  • delete the entity from all workspaces
item.summary: When deleting a shared item from its primary workspace, the user may choose to remove from the workspace instead of delete

comments.comment: alternative: interdire la suppression si utilisé dans un autre workspace

J'ai choisi l'alternative :"interdire la suppression si utilisé dans un autre workspace"

Pour le moment, le delete est sur un item. On supprime l'item, ca le supprime partout.
Il faudrait un peu plus approfondir le delete d'un item par workspace.
Si l'on veut faire ca, il faudrait mettre un champ delete dans la relation item_workspaces.
for the moment, when deleted from it's primary workspace, the next first workspace in the list will be the owner.

The behavior should be discussed in the following cases:

  • Remove (not delete) a shared copy
  • Delete from workspace
    a) when there is no sharing, no use in assessment
    b) when there is no sharing, but it is used in assessments
    b) when it is shared
    c) when it is shared and used in assessments of other workspaces

Instead it should stay in WS1.

Steps:

  1. Create two workspaces WS1, WS2

  3. Goto process list in WS1
  4. Share WS1
  5. Select WS2 and export
  6. The current workspace in now WS2 (to prove it, click on Process in Navigation bar: you see P1 and P2)

item.title: [OP-356] Login process for exceptions
item.description:
In normal circumstances, the user logs then enters the last used workspace.

1) If there is no last used workspace, then the user enters any workspace of which he is owner
2) If there is no last used workspace AND the user is owner of no workspace, then a landing page is shown with a sentence: "You have no workspace for the moment, you may create one by clicking "Create" (button) Or you may join someone else's workspace <list of workspaces with either view_workspace or change_workspace permissions>
2.1) If additionally the user has no licence to create a workspace, then only the second part of the sentence is displayed
2.2) If additionally the user has a licence but not permission to other workspaces, then only the first part of the sentence is displayed
2.3) if the user has no licence and no permission to any workspace, then the sentence is displayed : "Oops your system is not well configured, ask your administrator <email> to either grant you a licence OR to invite you in some workspace."
item.summary: Login process for exceptions

comments.comment: See also OP-544 Done

Point 2 NOK:

  1. last visited = null and user is not owner of a workspace => error 500 at login
  2. Note: in the example below, the user was owner of a deleted workspace
    #
    DoesNotExist at /workspace/1/dashboard/
    Workspace matching query does not exist.
    Request Method: GET
    Request URL: https://test.opexalliance.com/workspace/1/dashboard/
    Django Version: 1.11.8
    Exception Type: DoesNotExist
    Exception Value:
    Workspace matching query does not exist.
    Exception Location: /home/opex/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/django/db/models/query.py in get, line 380
    Python Executable: /usr/bin/python3
    Python Version: 3.5.3
    Python Path:
    ['/var/www/portal',
    '/usr/lib/python35.zip',
    '/usr/lib/python3.5',
    '/usr/lib/python3.5/plat-x86_64-linux-gnu',
    '/usr/lib/python3.5/lib-dynload',
    '/home/opex/.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages',
    '/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages',
    '/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages']
    Server time: Tue, 2 Jan 2018 11:22:44 -0600

Other problem:

  1. A user logs in, without workspace and without access to any workspace
  2. The system displays a page with the list of workspaces (ok)
  3. The system says that the user has no access (True) and no licence to create a workspace but the second part is wrong !

The right text will be :
This page lists all the workspaces you own or to which you have access.

You currently have been granted access to no workspace and you don't have a licence to create one. Please contact your administrator

We have to run this command: "manage.py collectstatic --noinput"

This command let Python find all the static files in the entire application and move them to the right folder set by "static_root", for us : static/

item.title: [OP-320] A user may grant an access to his workspace(s)
item.description:
A user may invite other users to a workspace he/she has created, provided than the granting user (1) has himself the right he wants to grant and (2) he has a "grant" right on this workspace.
The rights that may be granted are: consult (read), update (modify existing objects), full write (create/delete objects) and "grant" (grant rights to other users).

The grantee may still need additional rights/licence to perform some operations in the workspace.
item.summary: A user may grant an access to his workspace(s)

item.description: The user (under certain conditions?) may grant an access to a workspace to another user who does not belong to the organisation (e.g. a consultant)

item.description: At any time during his work, the user may switch from a workspace to another

Place a button "Report" close to the "Show result" button, visible under the same conditions (i.e. assessment complete).

item.title: [OP-280] The answer to a question is computed from the answer to subquestions
item.description: ... only when the question has been digged into
item.summary: The answer to a question is computed from the answer to subquestions

comments.comment:
Negative test:

  1. Answer Yes to a question => Yes in the diagram, OK
  2. Then open more detailed questions
  3. Answer many no and a few yes to a question
    => appears as Yes in the diagram (should be no)

Second negative test (same behavior, but inverted)

  1. Answer No to a question => No in the diagram, OK
  2. Back to the questionnaire, then more detailed questions
  3. answer Yes to all subquestions
  4. The question is still No in the diagram

=> Apparently, if someone first answers the question then saves, then opens subquestions, the top-level answer is still used.
I guess this is because the compute_answer method is called only when the answer is null => it should be called also when the answer is inactive

In the Answer model, define a property method name 'effective_answer'
the goal of the method is to provide the "real" answer to a question, not the answer that is stored in the the 'answer' field (which should maybe be rename differently, for example: manual_answer)

Warning:

  1. Use effective answer is diagrams instead of answer
  2. Use effective answer in reports instead of answer

The computation of effective answer is as follows:

  • if the Answer is active, then the effective answer is the manual answer;
  • if the Answer is not active, then the effective answer is the result of compute_answer;
j'ai remis le trigger

item.title: [OP-277] The system does not verify that scans are of the same type before comparing their results
item.description:
The comparison is then meaningless...
=> check that all scans use the same scanner when selecting them.
Eventually, refuse at the moment of clicking rather than letting the user select many and then only blocking him.
item.summary: The system does not verify that scans are of the same type before comparing their results

comments.comment:
Steps:

  1. Create an assessment with questionnaire OPMM
  2. Create a second assessment with questionnaire OPMM5
  3. The system accepts to compare them, but they are not the same questionnaire !!

The messages should be:

"The questionnaires are not of the same type: <title1>, <title2> ... and <title n> may not be compared."
This is not the message I asked for :-(
Is it possible, in the compare page, to disable the assessments that are not compatible with the already selected one?
Assessments not compatible will be disabled.

Good, just one detail left:

  1. Click “Compare”
  2. Select one assessment
  3. the button on top is “Compare Assessment” instead of “Compare Assessments” (missing “s”)

item.title: [OP-262] Delete an entity
item.description:
The process analyst may delete an entity that is not useful anymore.
There should be some cascading rules, with warning for users:

  • the scan results should be removed for that entity
  • it should be removed from the scan scope of ongoing scans
  • it should be removed from entity relationships
  • sub-entities should be removed as well (or brought up one level)

Alternatives: physical or logical (marked deleted)
item.summary: Delete an entity

comments.comment:
Alternatively, the entity could be marked as "obsolete" or "deleted"
and:
not appear in choice lists in the future
not be deleted from past scans
identified as "obsolete" in pas scans

Bug.
Steps to reproduce:

  1. Create processes P1, P2
  2. Create an assessment A
  3. Add P1, P2 to the scope of A
  4. Start answering to the questionnaire of A
  5. Delete P1 => Should be refused, but the system accepts
  6. P1 is not anymore in the list of processes
  7. Go back to A, on the assessment page P1 is still there !!
  8. Edit properties of A: P1 is not in the scope anymore - inconsistency...
  9. Click on P1 => Oups Error 500

The behavior is OK: the item is not deleted if it is in the scope of an assessment

BUT the user should be notified with a banner (warning)

Bug: can't delete after removing from assessment

  1. Add item to assessment
  2. Try to delete: not possible = OK
  3. Delete assessment
  4. try to delete: not possible = NOK

The message is: You may not delete this item because it is used in the assessment[s]:

but there is no assessment name !

The same happens to the next item created.

Probable cause: the message is wrong and the item may not be deleted because it is shared, not because it is in an assessment.

item.description: The user may draw graphicalkly a SIPOC diagram to represent the process actors and the product flow

item.title: [OP-167] Graphically edit a process landscape
item.description: The user may define the inter-process relationships graphically, on a process landscape diagram, i.e. a diagram where all processes (bubbles) may be linked together by links (dependency, usage). The list of possible links is determined in the metamodel. There may be one such diagram per department, process group, hierarchical level.
item.summary: Graphically edit a process landscape

item.title: [OP-166] The system records relationships between processes
item.description: The system allows the user to establish and comment relationships between processes.Such relationships include: dependencies, inclusion, triggering.The types of dependencies is part of the meta model.
item.summary: The system records relationships between processes

item.title: [OP-890] User defined attributes in the meta-model
item.description:
The system allows the user to define its own meta-data for documenting entities.

For example:

  • adding quantitative information to processes (measurements, quality Criteria, number of people operating the process, frequency of the process execution, financial income provided by the processetc.)
item.summary: User defined attributes in the meta-model

item.title: [OP-164] The system records qualitative data about processes
item.description: Mandatory Data to be recorded include:<ul> <li>Process Name</li> <li>List of process inputs</li> <li>List of process outputs</li> <li>Actors of the process, and their roles</li> <li>Description of the process</li> <li>Type of the process (core, support, management)</li></ul>Optional Data to be recorded include:<ul> <li>Description of the process KPI</li> <li>Description of the process Quality Criteria</li></ul>
item.summary: The system records qualitative data about processes

item.summary: Document process actors

item.title: [OP-162] Document process inputs & outputs
item.summary: Document process inputs & outputs

item.title: [OP-161] Identify processes dependencies
item.description: The system records the relationships between processes:dependencies: a process may not be executed if another one has not be executed beforehandI/O flow: the output of a process is used as inputs for another onetriggering: one process triggers another one
item.summary: Identify processes dependencies

item.title: [OP-160] Define item hierarchies
item.description:
The user may define groups (folders) of entities, so as to organise them when their number grows.

In practice: use aggregations between items of the same category.

Suppose there is an aggregation A with relation R between items of Category C.

When Item X is connected to item Y with relation R, then we say Y is a child of X.

On the category C page, display only the items that are not children of another item.

Rename the “View” button to “Edit”

Display the parents in a different color.

NOTE: there may be more than aggregation active at the same time.
item.summary: Define item hierarchies

comments.comment:
• add a "group" field in item
  • for the layout collapse with the group name and when uncollapsed show cards of all item in that group (like jira sprints)

item.title: [OP-159] Organization Description
item.description: The system allows the users to describe the organization. This includes: Organization name, address, etc. number of employees Business goal Stakeholders Current challenges Top level products Clients and client categories Suppliers Organizational structure as a hierarchical list of departments, with a short description of the role of each department (option: hierarchical diagram); The description is timestamped since it may evolve. Changes are traced.
item.summary: Organization Description

comments.comment: Implemented as entities

item.description: The systems allows to record and maintain a central repository of user's terms and definitions. For each word, the user provides a description and eventually a translation.
item.summary: Vocabulary Management

item.summary: Identify and describe processes

item.title: [OP-156] Document the object model
item.description: Define the object model of the organization = list of physical or virtual items that may be manipulated during processes (e.g. orders, invoices, parts). This is a sophistication of the vocabulary. Option: do not separate vocabulary and object model, but simply check some entries as this is an object manipulated during processes.
item.summary: Document the object model

comments.comment: Implemented with entities

item.title: [OP-155] Document the organisation's products & services
item.description: The list of products and/or services delivered by the organization. The list may be structured in product families and each item will have a structured description (name, type, etc.) Each product may be linked to one or more client types (the clients who consume the product/service);
item.summary: Document the organisation's products & services

comments.comment: Implemented as entities

item.title: [OP-154] Document the organization suppliers
item.description:
The system allows to establish a list of the types of suppliers of the organization.
The goal is not to get the name of each supplier, but rather to identify supplier types (e.g. service suppliers for logistics suppliers, goods, consumable or raw material providers, etc.); as for the rest: each supplier type will be documented briefly;
item.summary: Document the organization suppliers

comments.comment: Implemented as entities

item.title: [OP-153] Document organization clients & users
item.description:
The system allows to establish a list of the types of clients of the organization; the goal is not to list each client, but rather to identify client types (e.g. Retail Consumers, Citizen, brokers, resellers, etc.).
Each client type may be documented briefly.
item.summary: Document organization clients & users

comments.comment: Implemented as entities

item.title: [OP-152] Describe the structure of the organization
item.description:
The system allows to record a structural description of the organization, in terms of departments and teams.

  • A hierarchical list of departments, with a short description of the role of each department (option: hierarchical diagram);
  • Roles and responsibilities: within each department, identify roles in the organization and in relation to the process(es) (e.g. production manager, production staff, secretary, accountant, etc.) they will be used in process documentation (predefined lists of roles/departments will be proposed but not imposed so as to ease further comparisons as much as possible) ;
item.summary: Describe the structure of the organization

item.title: [OP-978] Document project goals
item.description: The user explains what are the goals of the projects, ideally in measurable terms.
item.summary: Document project goals

item.title: [OP-975] Select project priorities
item.description: Identify what axis is a priority, and for which ones there is an acceptation of risks/lower maturity. The assessments that belong to the project have several dimensions.It is possible to rank the dimensions, so that by default:<ul> <li>High priority dimensions will use deep rather that quick scans</li> <li>Low priority dimensions will use quick rather that deep scans</li></ul>
item.summary: Select project priorities

item.title: [OP-130] Conduct Assessment
item.description:
Assessments are the starting point of every project. They are the main component of the "Plan" phase of the PDCA cycle.The systems allows to conducting an assessment, in a user-friendly and flexible way.It also allows to conduct several assessments in parallel, to compare assessment results, e.g. over time or over different process groups. Assessments may be performed iteratively, process per process and the results grouped in a whole synthesis.The assessment module is methodologically neutral: it allows for OPEX Model assessments, but for any kind of assessment as well.

The system asks a list of questions and collected the right type of answer: yes/no graduated answers According to the model, the questions are grouped in dimensions. The system allows the user to choose shallow vs deep assessment for each dimension independently. The system asks the questions that correspond to the depth of the assessment. When questions are correlated, the system: asks the questions in the logical order asks some questions based on the answers to other questions Apart from the case of correlated questions, the user may answer questions in any order. The system keeps track and shows visibly the progress of the assessment.
item.summary: Conduct Assessment

item.title: [OP-128] Use assessment Models
item.description: The assessment system may be enriched with new types of assessments, allowing to assess from different perspectives, or to assess specific types of processes or eventually organization units, etc.
item.summary: Use assessment Models

item.title: [OP-936] Collaborative Assessments
item.description: The user who initiates an assessment may invite other people from the organization to give their own answers to the questionnaire. The system will collect and synthesize the answers.
item.summary: Collaborative Assessments
